We’re team dot dot dot,

and we created the

Portabraille Printer,

a portable braille printer!

 

Read on to learn more about

Portabraille, or click on one of

the tabs above for more info!

We created the Portabraille Printer with those who are visually impaired in mind.

 

Insert info about user testing and any features we designed with those who are visually impaired in mind (eg: interface, portability, etc)

The Portabraille Printer takes in a text file, converts it to braille, and embosses a sheet of paper with the converted braille.

 

First, users input their file via a USB port. *insert info about how the text-to-braille software works and probably a bit about the interface too, try to keep it simple and elaborate later in the blog*

Next, the printer *insert info about how the firmware works, also insert info about the mechanical design*

Finally, the Portabraille Printer spits out a page of freshly printed braille, ready for the reading!

 

For a more technical overview of what the printer does and how we built it, head to our blog here.

This project was created as part of Principles of Engineering, a course at Olin College of Engineering in Needham, MA.

*insert thank-yous/credits*
